skill.name: developer-growth-analysis
skill.description: Analyzes your recent Claude Code chat history to identify coding patterns, development gaps, and areas for improvement, curates relevant learning resources from HackerNews, and automatically sends a personalized growth report to your Slack DMs.
skill.summary: Analyzes your recent Claude Code chat history to identify coding patterns, development gaps, and are...
skill.author: ComposioHQ

security_audit.summary: This is a pure prompt-based skill with no executable code. The static analyzer flagged 45 issues, but all are false positives caused by pattern matching against markdown code fences, metadata hash fields, and legitimate file paths. The skill reads from Claude Code's own history file for analysis purposes, which is its stated function.
low_findings: Reads from ~/.claude/history.jsonl - this is expected behavior for the skill's stated purpose of analyzing Claude Code chat history

content.user_title: Analyze your coding patterns and identify growth areas
content.value_statement: Tracking your development progress and identifying skill gaps is difficult without structured feedback. This skill analyzes your Claude Code chat history to identify improvement areas and curates relevant learning resources from HackerNews.
actual_capabilities: Reads Claude Code chat history from the past 24-48 hours
Identifies development patterns and technologies used
Detects skill gaps with specific evidence from your work
Searches HackerNews for relevant learning resources
Sends complete growth report to your Slack DMs
limitations: Only analyzes Claude Code chat history, not other tools or IDEs
Learning resources are limited to HackerNews discussions
Requires Slack connection via Rube MCP for report delivery
Analysis quality depends on depth of chat history

use_cases.title: Weekly growth review
use_cases.description: Get automated insights on your coding patterns and skill gaps. Receive curated learning resources based on your actual work.

use_cases.title: Structured learning path
use_cases.description: Receive evidence-based recommendations for what to learn next. The suggestions are grounded in your real coding challenges.

use_cases.title: Team development support
use_cases.description: Help team members identify their growth areas and find relevant learning materials automatically.

prompt_templates.title: Quick analysis
prompt_templates.prompt: Analyze my developer growth from my recent chats

prompt_templates.title: Today's focus
prompt_templates.prompt: Analyze my work from today and suggest areas for improvement

prompt_templates.title: Weekly review
prompt_templates.prompt: Give me a comprehensive growth report for the past week including learning resources

prompt_templates.title: Targeted skill analysis
prompt_templates.prompt: Analyze my recent chats and identify specific areas where I can improve my TypeScript skills

output_examples.input: Analyze my developer growth from my recent chats
output: Work Summary: Focused on backend development with TypeScript and React across three projects
Improvement Areas: Advanced TypeScript patterns, secure data handling, component architecture
Strengths: Security awareness, iterative refinement, full-stack capability
Action Items: Study utility types, document security patterns, apply composition patterns
Resources: 6 curated HackerNews articles matched to your improvement areas

output_examples.input: Analyze my work from today and suggest areas for improvement
output: Today's Focus: API design and database optimization tasks
Key Challenge: Multiple iterations on query performance
Recommendation: Study database indexing strategies and query optimization
Resource: HackerNews discussion on PostgreSQL query performance
Next Step: Apply EXPLAIN ANALYZE to identify slow queries

best_practices: Run analysis weekly to track improvement trajectory over time
Focus on one improvement area before moving to the next
Use the curated HackerNews resources as a targeted study guide
anti_patterns: Running analysis daily when patterns need time to emerge
Ignoring the evidence-based recommendations without trying them
Skipping the action items and not following up on suggestions

faq.question: Which chat history does this skill analyze?
faq.answer: It reads from ~/.claude/history.jsonl to analyze your Claude Code conversations from the past 24-48 hours.

faq.question: How long does the analysis take?
faq.answer: The full analysis typically completes in 30-60 seconds depending on the amount of chat history to process.

faq.question: Do I need a Slack account?
faq.answer: Yes, Slack connection via Rube MCP is required to receive the growth report in your direct messages.

faq.question: Is my chat data sent anywhere external?
faq.answer: Chat history is analyzed locally. The generated report is sent only to your own Slack DMs via Rube MCP.

faq.question: Why are learning resources from HackerNews only?
faq.answer: HackerNews provides high-quality, peer-vetted technical content that is relevant and up-to-date for developers.

faq.question: How often should I run this analysis?
faq.answer: Weekly analysis works best. Running it too frequently may not show meaningful changes in your patterns.
